headings: Bachelor of Applied Arts and Sciences
Are you ready to take the next step in your career?
Bachelor of Applied Arts and Sciences
What Can You Do With a B.A.A.S. Degree?
paragraphs: If you have already earned an associate degree from an accredited institution of higher education, our B.A.A.S. program could be the perfect fit!

This program is designed to be a pathway to completing a bachelor’s degree. Your associate degree can be in any area, including technical degrees, and you can choose your specialization from four different options:

Academic courses taken either as part of your associate degree or independent of it may apply toward ASU’s core curriculum requirements. You should be aware that some majors specify particular courses to meet the 42-credit-hour Texas core curriculum requirement.

Associate degrees from Texas community colleges include at least 9-15 credit hours of academic coursework that may be counted toward ASU’s core curriculum requirements. However, transferring fewer than 12 credit hours of academic coursework may require you to extend your bachelor’s degree beyond 120 hours.
ASU Distinguished ScholarshipsOur premier scholarships are awarded based on your academic achievement, and you don’t even have to apply. You are automatically considered once you are admitted to ASU.
General ScholarshipsWe offer over 600 different types of scholarships. You can apply for both our general scholarships and degree-specific scholarships with one application.
Blue and Gold GuaranteeIf you have financial need, you may qualify forfree tuitionto attend Angelo State.
Start your career as soon as you graduate! You will have the necessary skills to explore career opportunities in your specialization area, or continue your education at the graduate level.

OurFreshman Collegeis a one-stop resource for programs and services that help you transition into college life, improve your communication skills, and engage in active learning. You can also get academic help in theMath LabandWriting Center, receive peer mentoring and tutoring throughSupplemental Instruction, or set up onlinetutoringsessions.
If you want to go fast, go alone. But if you want to go far, go together.
